resource_dependency.stockSearchAPI: A backend API endpoint at /api/stocks/search that accepts query parameters for stock code or name and returns matching stocks.
resource_dependency.stockReportGenerateAPI: A backend API endpoint at /api/reports/generate that accepts selected stock ID, report format, and content preferences, then returns a generated report object.
resource_dependency.databaseConnectionConfig: PostgreSQL connection using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp

function: Frontend application that fetches all stock data dynamically from backend APIs
static_description: A responsive web page with a white background and navy-colored UI components including a header bar, main content area, and footer. The layout includes a search bar at the top, followed by a results section and an optional report preview panel.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the search button triggers a call to the stockSearchAPI with the entered query. Results are displayed in a list below the search bar.
Pressing Enter while focused on the search input field initiates the same search functionality as clicking the search button.

resource_dependency.postgresqlConnection: Establish a connection to PostgreSQL using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
resource_dependency.stockDataSchema: Create table 'stocks' with fields: id (UUID), symbol (string), name (string), sector (string), industry (string), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp). Create table 'market_trends' with fields: trend_id (UUID), stock_id (foreign key to stocks.id), date (date), price_change (float), volume (integer). Create table 'financials' with fields: financial_id (UUID), stock_id (foreign key to stocks.id), fiscal_year (integer), revenue (float), net_income (float), eps (float).
resource_dependency.reportGenerationLogic: Implement logic to aggregate stock data, market trends, and financials into structured reports based on user-defined formats.

function: Backend API service that connects to external PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
static_description: No visible UI element; this is a server-side component responsible for handling requests from the frontend and interacting with the PostgreSQL database.

function: Stock search functionality allowing users to input stock codes or names
static_description: At the top of the page, there is a horizontal container with a text input field labeled 'Search Stocks' and a navy-colored 'Search' button next to it.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Search' button sends the current value of the input field to the backend via the stockSearchAPI.
While the input field is focused, pressing Enter simulates a click on the 'Search' button.

resource_dependency.reportOptionsSelector: Dropdown menus or checkboxes for selecting report format (PDF, HTML) and content sections (Basic Info, Market Trends, Financial Data)
resource_dependency.reportPreviewArea: Section displaying the generated report after successful API response

function: Report generation feature that creates customized stock reports based on user selections
static_description: Below the search results, there is a form containing dropdown selectors for report format and checkboxes for content inclusion. A navy 'Generate Report' button is present beneath the options.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Generate Report' sends selected options along with the chosen stock ID to the stockReportGenerateAPI. Upon receiving the result, the report is rendered in the preview area.

resource_dependency.contentCheckboxes: List of checkboxes labeled: 'Basic Stock Information', 'Market Trends', 'Financial Data'

function: User interface for selecting report formats and content options
static_description: Two sections under the search results: one with a dropdown titled 'Select Format' showing available report types, and another listing three checkboxes titled 'Include Sections'.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking any checkbox toggles its selection state. Clicking the dropdown reveals a list of available formats which can be selected.

resource_dependency.basicInfoFields: Fields such as Symbol, Company Name, Sector, Industry pulled from the stocks table

function: Display of basic stock information in generated reports
static_description: Within the report preview area, a section titled 'Basic Stock Information' displays key details about the selected stock in a clean tabular format.

resource_dependency.trendChartData: Time-series data retrieved from the market_trends table associated with the selected stock

function: Inclusion of market trends data in stock reports
static_description: Inside the report, a dedicated section shows a line chart representing recent price changes over time, sourced from the market trends database.

resource_dependency.financialDataTable: Tabular representation of yearly financial metrics sourced from the financials table linked to the selected stock

function: Integration of financial data in stock reports
static_description: The report contains a table titled 'Financial Overview' presenting annual revenue, net income, and earnings per share for multiple years.

function: White background color applied throughout the website
static_description: Entire webpage has a solid white (#FFFFFF) background across all views and screen sizes.

function: Navy color scheme for all UI components
static_description: All buttons, active input borders, and highlighted navigation items use navy blue (#000080) as their primary color against a light or white backdrop.

resource_dependency.installScriptCommand: "install:all": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\""

function: Package.json configuration with 'install:all' script for simultaneous frontend and backend dependency installation
static_description: In package.json root directory, a script named 'install:all' runs concurrent commands to execute 'npm install' in both frontend and backend directories.

resource_dependency.devScriptCommand: "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\""

function: Package.json configuration with 'dev' script to concurrently start frontend and backend services
static_description: In package.json root directory, a script named 'dev' executes development servers for both frontend and backend simultaneously using concurrently.

resource_dependency.postgresConnectionPool: Use node-postgres or equivalent library to manage database connections securely using provided environment variables

function: Database operations strictly using the configured PostgreSQL connection
static_description: No visible UI element; ensures all CRUD operations on stock, market trends, and financial data go through the predefined PostgreSQL instance.

resource_dependency.noMockDataPolicy: Ensure no static assets or hardcoded JSON files are used for dynamic content; everything comes from live API calls backed by the PostgreSQL database

function: No hardcoded or mock data - all information fetched from backend APIs
static_description: Application does not load any local data files or embed sample datasets directly in code; all dynamic content originates from API endpoints connected to the database.

function: Responsive web design compatible with standard browser dimensions
static_description: Layout adjusts fluidly between mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports using CSS media queries to maintain usability and readability across devices.
